metadata.Title: CVE-2019-0201 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - low
metadata.Description: An issue is present in Apache ZooKeeper 1.0.0 to 3.4.13 and 3.5.0-alpha to3.5.4-beta. ZooKeeper’s getACL() command doesn’t check any permission whenretrieves the ACLs of the requested node and returns all informationcontained in the ACL Id field as plaintext string.DigestAuthenticationProvider overloads the Id field with the hash valuethat is used for user authentication. As a consequence, if DigestAuthentication is in use, the unsalted hash value will be disclosed bygetACL() request for unauthenticated or unprivileged users.

criterions.comment: zookeeper: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
